posts.cooked: I wonder if there will be a single software application that can handle all types of tasks, such as dashboard programming and tuning, by combining resources from both WPilib and CTRE.

posts.name: Dan Katzuv
posts.cooked: It is not a single application, but we use Tuner X specifically for Phoenix devices and AdvantageScope for other devices.

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked: Does Advantagescope support SendableChooser? I like Advantagescope, but we use glass for controls because we have many choosers.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Elastic is currently the modern driver dashboard we provide. Other community options include QFRCDashboard. We plan to discontinue SmartDashboard and Shuffleboard in 2027 as they have not been maintained for years.  

We do not aim to create a unified driver dashboard and debug tool. The distinct functionalities make it impractical to combine them into one application.  

What are your goals for unification?

posts.name: Matthew Milunic
posts.cooked: The AdvantageScope does support NT tunables. You just need to click the icon with the three sliders.

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked: Elastic does not inherently support a mechanism known as "Mechanism2D," similar to what Glass provides, in its default setup. However, users may still implement 2D functionality through integration with external libraries or by developing custom solutions, allowing them to leverage existing tools and adapt to their specific needs.

posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked: You are correct. Though I can never find the documentation on it.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Sure! Here's the cleaned-up text:

"Not yet, I think? It is certainly something that can be added. Note that it is perfectly fine to use a mix of multiple applications, even simultaneously."
